content:
Diagnosis
	1. Left main bronchus typical carcinoid tumor
	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Bronchoscopic biopsy

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated at present

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Localized disease

	Current issues
	Intermittent hemoptysis

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] is a 45-year-old lady who has been diagnosed with a typical carcinoid tumor of the left main bronchus following investigation of intermittent hemoptysis. CT thorax on 10/3/24 showed a 2.8cm well-circumscribed endobronchial lesion. Bronchoscopic biopsy confirmed typical carcinoid morphology with Ki67 <2% and strong SSTR2 expression. Staging investigations including Gallium-68 DOTATATE PET-CT on 20/3/24 showed no evidence of nodal or distant disease.

She has an excellent performance status (WHO PS 0) and continues to work full-time. She reports occasional hemoptysis but no other respiratory symptoms. No weight loss or systemic symptoms.

	Further investigations
	Pulmonary function tests booked for 2/4/24

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Thoracic surgery outpatient appointment arranged for 5/4/24
MDT discussion planned for 3/4/24

	Required GP actions
	None at present

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Discussed likely need for surgical resection. Explained typical carcinoid characteristics and generally favorable prognosis. Patient information leaflet provided.

cancer_timeline.value: CT thorax shows 2.8cm well-circumscribed endobronchial lesion
Biopsy confirms typical carcinoid morphology with Ki67 <2% and strong SSTR2 expression
Gallium-68 DOTATATE PET-CT shows no evidence of nodal or distant disease

patient_facts.value: Occasional hemoptysis but no other respiratory symptoms

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed typical carcinoid tumor of left main bronchus. Localized disease suitable for surgical evaluation.
Thoracic surgery outpatient appointment 5/4/24, MDT discussion planned for 3/4/24
